meanings.definition: The darker side or aspect of something, especially of a person's personality.
meanings.sent1: She always kept her nightsides hidden from others.
meanings.sent2: His nightsides were revealed when he thought no one was watching.
meanings.sent3: It's like his nightsides only come out to play when the moon is high.
meanings.sent4: Her nightsides lurked in the shadows of her thoughts, waiting to emerge.
meanings.sent5: The nightsides of his character were a mystery to those around him.

meanings.definition: The part of a building or area that is in shadow or darkness during the night.
meanings.sent1: The nightsides of the house were cold and eerie after sunset.
meanings.sent2: The nightsides of the park were not well-lit for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: The nightsides of the city seemed to hold secrets under the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: Shadows danced on the nightsides of the building, creating a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the nightsides of the forest felt like stepping into another world.

meanings.definition: The opposite side of a planet or celestial body from the side facing the sun.
meanings.sent1: The nightsides of the moon were shrouded in darkness.
meanings.sent2: The nightsides of the Earth are illuminated by starlight.
meanings.sent3: Aliens might inhabit the nightsides of distant planets we cannot see.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the nightsides of the galaxy would require advanced technology.
meanings.sent5: The nightsides of the universe hold mysteries beyond our imagination.
